intro: Quercus stenophylla var. angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved canyon oak, is a variant of the canyon oak native to the western United States. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter in color underneath. The plant produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in canyons and mountainous regions. This variant is adapted to arid and semi-arid climates, showcasing resilience to drought conditions.
